metadata.Title: CVE-2019-16231 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
drivers/net/fjes/fjes_main.c in the Linux kernel 5.2.14 does not check the alloc_workqueue return value, leading to a NULL pointer dereference. It was discovered that the Fujitsu ES network device driver for the Linux kernel did not properly check for errors in some situations, leading to a NULL pointer dereference. A local attacker could use this to cause a denial of service.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-16231` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1090-aws - 4.4.0-1090.94
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1066-azure - 4.15.0-1066.71~14.04.1

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0-12.19').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1090.94').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1066.71~14.04.1').
